summary: Expand VisaTrack beyond personal visa record tracking to also include a mock 'Australian Visa Check' screen where users can enter Application ID + email and view a custom status (not connected to government systems).
architectural_notes: User requested removing the non-government disclaimer and official resource links from the website UI; review placement/content strategy accordingly.
Add a mock 'Visa Check' module with local/admin-defined status mapping keyed by Application ID (and optionally email) with explicit non-integration messaging (no government backend).
known_issues: Compliance/UX risk: removing the non-government disclaimer and official links could increase perceived affiliation with government services; confirm legal/compliance requirements before shipping.

Compliance/UX risk: implementing an 'Australian Visa Check' status screen (even as a mock) may increase perceived government affiliation; ensure clear disclosure and avoid implying access to official status systems.

existing_features.title: Add Internet Identity sign-in and require authentication for any create/read/update/delete actions on stored visa records.
Create a dashboard UI that lets authenticated users add, view, edit, and delete their saved visa records with a clear, form-based workflow and validation (required fields, date validation).

Add reminder management for each visa record: allow users to set one or more reminder dates (e.g., 30/14/7 days before expiry or custom date) and show an in-app ‘Upcoming reminders’ section highlighting reminders due soon/overdue.

Include a clear non-government disclaimer and provide official links for users to check status via official portals (VEVO and ImmiAccount) without attempting to replicate or impersonate government services.
Establish a coherent visual theme (colors, typography, spacing, components) appropriate for a neutral personal tracker app, and apply it consistently across landing, auth, dashboard, and forms.
Generate and include simple custom static visuals for the app (logo and a minimal hero illustration) and render them from frontend static assets.
Remove the non-government disclaimer block and the 'Official Resources' (VEVO and ImmiAccount) links section from the site footer UI so that none of that content appears anywhere in the footer.
Remove the 'Official Government Resources' section from the landing page, including any buttons/links to VEVO and ImmiAccount, and remove the hero 'Check Official Status' external link button.
Create a new frontend page/screen labeled "Australian Visa Check" that lets a user enter Application ID and Email, submit, and view the returned custom status (or a clear "No status found" message).
Provide an authenticated management UI for custom statuses where signed-in users can create, edit, and delete status entries for (Application ID, Email) and set a user-defined status text.
Add navigation so users can reach the "Australian Visa Check" screen from the existing app UI without editing immutable hook/provider files.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a non-government visa helper app for users to store their own visa details (expiry date, notes) and manage reminders.

Implement backend data model and APIs to store a user’s visa records including: visa label/name, visa grant number/reference (optional), visa expiry date, conditions/notes (free text), and created/updated timestamps.
Remove the non-government disclaimer and the 'Official Resources' links (VEVO, ImmiAccount) section from the website UI.
Add an 'Australian Visa Check' screen that accepts Application ID and email and shows a user-defined custom status per Application ID (mock/non-government; no real government integration).

Add backend support for a mock Australian visa application status registry keyed by (Application ID, Email) where authenticated users can create, update, list, and delete custom status entries (no integration with any external/government systems).
Add a backend query method that allows checking the stored custom status by providing Application ID and Email, returning the matching entry (or null if none exists).
